segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Registry (Global Object Access Auditing), which enables you to configure a global system access control list (SACL) on the registry of a computer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Registry (Global Object Access Auditing), which enables you to configure a global system access control list (SACL) on the registry of a computer.

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Registry (Global Object Access Auditing), which enables you to configure a global system access control list (SACL) on the registry of a computer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Registry (Global Object Access Auditing), which enables you to configure a global system access control list (SACL) on the registry of a computer.

segment.source: If you select the Configure security check box on this policy’s property page, you can add a user or group to the global SACL.
segment.target: If you select the Configure security check box on this policy’s property page, you can add a user or group to the global SACL.

segment.source: This enables you to define computer system access control lists (SACLs) per object type for the registry.
segment.target: This enables you to define computer system access control lists (SACLs) per object type for the registry.

segment.source: The specified SACL is then automatically applied to every registry object type.
segment.target: The specified SACL is then automatically applied to every registry object type.

segment.source: This policy setting must be used in combination with the Registry security policy setting under Object Access.
segment.target: This policy setting must be used in combination with the Registry security policy setting under Object Access.

segment.source: For more info, see Audit Registry.
segment.target: For more info, see Audit Registry.
